author: wsjcom
title: A Few Philosophers but Lots of Electricians
text: Good mechanics are in short supply, especially good ones who specialize in diesels (“Trade School Wins Fans Among Teens,” U.S. News, March 6). If you decide to enter the trade you’ll find yourself in a challenging, demanding (both physically and mentally) and ultimately, extremely rewarding career. Additionally you’ll be well compensated. In our shop, journeymen make $45 an hour, time-and-a-half after eight hours and double time after 16 hours and on Sunday, along with a premium benefits package. It’s often hard, dirty work, but after doing this for nearly 50 years, I still look forward to going to work each day, which...
